96418.name: Exports to lower-middle income grouping (Fouquin and Hugot (CEPII 2016), Dyadic)
96418.description: Value of merchandise exports by destination as a share of GDP. All partner countries are classified into income groups according to the latest World Bank classification. Calculations use Fouqin and Hugot (CEPII 2016) dyadic trade data.
96418.datasetName: Split of exports to different country groups - OWID calculations based on Fouquin and Hugot (CEPII 2016) dyadic data

source.name: Fouquin and Hugot (CEPII 2016)
source.dataPublishedBy: Michel Fouquin & Jules Hugot , 2016. "Two Centuries of Bilateral Trade and Gravity Data: 1827-2014," CEPII Working Paper 2016- 14 , May 2016 , CEPII
source.dataPublisherSource: IMF Direction of Trade Statistics data set, manuscripts
source.additionalInfo:
To calculate country exports to the rest of the world, the total value of exports by country, per year, is divided by the country's GDP. Calculations use Fouquin and Hugot (CEPII 2016) dyadic trade data.

The time series 'World' corresponds to the World's total exports (i.e. the sum of exports reported by all countries in the dataset).

The total export values of regional income aggregates have been calculated using the World Bank's income groupings.

Germany's time series is comprised of West Germany, and Germany. East Germany has been excluded for the purposes of Germany's calculations but is included in the World series.
Russia's time series comprises Russia and the USSR. 

Continental groupings are defined according to OWID's classification. Europe has been split into Western Europe including: Austria, Belgium, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Italy, the Netherlands, Norway, Portugal, Russia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, and the United Kingdom. Remaining European countries have been classified as Eastern Europe.

96419.datasetName: Split of exports to different country groups - OWID calculations based on Fouquin and Hugot (CEPII 2016) dyadic data

96420.name: Exports to low-income grouping (Fouquin and Hugot (CEPII 2016), Dyadic)
96420.description: The share of exports from each entity exported to low-income country grouping. Income groupings are determined according to the World Bank's 2016 income classification. Calculations use Fouqin and Hugot (CEPII 2016) dyadic trade data.
96420.datasetName: Split of exports to different country groups - OWID calculations based on Fouquin and Hugot (CEPII 2016) dyadic data
